AD_NightsongApostle.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Ketheric has transformed into his Apostle form/reached his second stage, Nightsong will react to this upon her first combat turn after this.
AD_NightsongApostle.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Nightsong.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Use "oe KethericShowdown_Transform". This will initiate stage 2 and transform Ketheric into the Apostle of Myrkul.- Once Nightsong gets her first turn in combat (and she is available to speak), this AD will play on her.

KethericIntro.synopsis: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
KethericIntro.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play first and set up some important stuff. After this, the dialog may start in several ways: 1 - get spotted by the (neutral) enemies in the boss chamber; 2 - start combat with anyone in Ketheric's combat group; 3 - free Nightsong from her cage (this should pull you into combat with her). Before triggering the dialog, the player might kill Isobel from stealth or destroy Nightsong's cage.Use the debug commands mentioned in the Act2_COL_KethericShowdown goal.

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone.synopsis: After the fight with Ketheric, Daisy asks us to grab Ketheric's Netherstone.

AD_Phase3Transition.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
AD_Phase3Transition.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Ketheric during the third phase of the fight, upon his first combat turn in the third phase.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Skip to phase 2 of the combat by using command "oe KethericShowdown_Transform", spam through the dialog.- Initiate phase 3 using "oe KethericShowdown_Phase3".- This AD will play on Ketheric when his turn starts.

AD_NightsongAfterCombat.synopsis: This dialogue will play when interacting with Nightsong after the Ketheric Showdown combat at the end of the Colony.
AD_NightsongAfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Defeat"  to teleport yourself to the Ketheric Showdown room and defeat Ketheric.- This dialogue will then be available on Nightsong by interacting with her.

AD_IsobelKilled.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player kills Isobel during the combat. Ketheric will react to this in human form.
AD_IsobelKilled.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Ketheric if Isobel is killed during the combat.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Use command "oe KethericShowdown_AudienceRoute" to make sure Isobel is here, and tadpoled.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric, go through that dialog too. Combat will start.- To check the Apostle form version, use "oe KethericShowdown_Transform".- Kill Isobel (either through ReCon or in-game combat). This AD will play on Ketheric.

PAD_AfterCombatComment.synopsis: A PAD commenting on defeating Ketheric in his Apostle form at the end of the mind flayer Colony. After this the player will say that they need to go discuss the next course of action with their allies (alluding to Intermezzo in Moonrise Tower).At this point the players should take Ketheric's Netherstone (but we can't ensure that a player hasn't already looted said netherstone off his corpse by the time that end node is played).If there are two players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.
PAD_AfterCombatComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use "oe KethericShowdown_Defeat"- Go through the interactive dialogue. A PAD should play afterwards.

KethericApostle.synopsis: This dialog shows Ketheric transforming into his second phase - the Apostle of Myrkul. This can either happen by beating Ketheric in his first phase or by convincing Ketheric of the error in his ways, provided the right conditions are met.
KethericApostle.how_to_trigger: This can be triggered by defeating Ketheric in his first phase (Nightsong must not be inside her soul cage at this point) or convincing Ketheric of his wrong-doings in the COL_KethericShowdown_KethericApostle dialog.ReCon commands:- oe KethericShowdown_Start (teleport to start and initiate ChosenThree dialog)- oe KethericShowdown_AssaultRoute (for the option to convince Ketheric and trigger the transformation from the KethericIntro dialog)- oe KethericShowdown_Transform (cue Apostle transformation)

AD_NightsongTransform.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Nightsong is freed from her soul cage. She will transform into her paladin form.
AD_NightsongTransform.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Nightsong.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Use "oe KethericShowdown_FreeNightsong". Nightsong will be freed.- Once Nightsong gets her first turn in combat (and she is available to speak), this AD will play on her as she transform into her paladin form.

ChosenThree.synopsis: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
ChosenThree.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play upon entering the large trigger here (S_COL_KethericShowdown_ChosenThree_Box_1581a588-b69f-41c9-a591-5959751f3cdf). Entering this trigger also initializes the boss chamber and the NPCs inside correctly.

AD_KethericCommandTroops.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when Ketheric uses his "Command Troops" ability to make his minions focus their efforts on attacking a specific target. This will only happen during the first phase, in Ketheric's human form.
AD_KethericCommandTroops.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when Ketheric uses his "Command Troops" ability to make his minions focus their efforts on attacking a specific target. This will only happen during the first phase, in Ketheric's human form.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric, go through that dialog too. Combat will start.- It is advisable to enter godmode with ReCon command "god". - Wait in combat for Ketheric to use this ability.

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.synopsis: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.

AD_KethericInvulnerable_Apostle.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player tries to damage Ketheric while he is invulnerable (Nightsong is still in the soul cage). Ketheric will react to the damage attempt. This will play if Ketheric is in his Apostle form.
AD_KethericInvulnerable_Apostle.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Ketheric if he is attacked while he is invulnerable, and he is past his first phase/in Apostle form.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric, go through that dialog too. Combat will start.- Attempt to damage Ketheric, while Nightsong is still caged. This will play once.

AD_NightsongFreed.synopsis: Ketheric comments on Nightsong being freed from her soul cage in the Colony, after the combat has already started, in his human form/first phase.
AD_NightsongFreed.how_to_trigger: Go to lower Colony in SCL_Main_A, to the Ketheric Showdown boss chamber ("oe KethericShowdown_Start"). This dialog will trigger if Nightsong is freed after the Ketheric combat has already started, in his first phase.

CrownController.synopsis: This dialog plays after picking up the Crown Controller ring off Ketheric’s body. The player will realize that they need to collect the other two Crown Controllers from Orin and Gortash before they can use them to command the Elder Brain. Picking up the Crown Controller allows the party to continue onward to the epilogue/intermezzo of Act 2.
CrownController.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play first and set up some important stuff.In order for this dialog to trigger, Ketheric must be defeated and the Crown Controller ring must be picked up from his body.Debug command: "oe KethericShowdown_Start" then "oe KethericShowdown_Defeat" then loot the Crown Controller ring off Ketheric's body.

AD_KethericFingerOfDeath.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. After Ketheric, in his Apostle form, calls his Necromite minions to him, they will sacrifice themselves to Ketheric, who will then gain the ability to use "Finger of Death". This ability does a lot of damage on its target, and will at this point in the game likely be a one-hit kill.
AD_KethericFingerOfDeath.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. After Ketheric, in his Apostle form, calls his Necromite minions to him, they will sacrifice themselves to Ketheric, who will then gain the ability to use "Finger of Death". Ketheric will be sure to use this ability when he gets the chance, provided a valid target is in range.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric.- It is advisable to enter godmode with ReCon command "god".- Use ReCon command "oe_KethericShowdown_Transform" to start the second phase of the fight.- Use "oe KethericShowdown_Phase3" to start his third phase.- Wait in combat for Ketheric to use this ability. The Necromites must reach him and sacrifice themselves before Ketheric can cast the ability.

AD_NightsongFreed_Apostle.synopsis: Ketheric comments on Nightsong being freed from her soul cage in the Colony, after the combat has already started, in his Apostle form. This means Ketheric will have been convinced to relent, and has been transformed into his Apostle form before Nightsong is freed from her soul cage.
AD_NightsongFreed_Apostle.how_to_trigger: Go to lower Colony in SCL_Main_A, to the Ketheric Showdown boss chamber ("oe KethericShowdown_Start"). This dialog will trigger if Nightsong is freed after the Ketheric combat has already started, after his first phase.

PAD_NightsongCaged.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, while the combat has started and Nightsong is still soul caged. The players must free her before Ketheric can be damaged. Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.
PAD_NightsongCaged.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on the first available player character.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric, go through that dialog too. Combat will start.- Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.

AD_KethericInvulnerable.synopsis: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player tries to damage Ketheric while he is invulnerable (Nightsong is still in the soul cage). Ketheric will react to the damage attempt. This will play if Ketheric is in his human form.
AD_KethericInvulnerable.how_to_trigger: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony. It will play on Ketheric if he is attacked while he is invulnerable, and he is in his first phase/human form.- Load SCL_Main_A- Using ReCon command "oe KethericShowdown_Start"  to teleport yourself there.- Go through the dialog, approach Ketheric, go through that dialog too. Combat will start.- Attempt to damage Ketheric, while Nightsong is still caged. This will play once.

KethericDefeated.synopsis: NOTE TO PITSTOP: We have a cinematic previz of this so be sure to ping for that if we haven't already sent it to you.This dialog plays after defeating Ketheric once and for all at the Colony Ketheric Showdown. Ketheric delivers a short speech before he dies.- If Nightsong's corpse is present in the chamber, she will revive. If she is alive by this point she will comment on finally being rid of Ketheric.
KethericDefeated.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25 (or use debug commands)Debug command: "oe KethericShowdown_Start" and then "oe KethericShowdown_Defeat"The Chosen Three cinematic will play first and set up some important stuff.In order for this dialog to trigger, Ketheric (in his Apostle of Myrkul) form must die during the Colony Ketheric Showdown. This means Nightsong must be either dead or freed from her soul cage, and Ketheric must be past his first stage and reach 0 hitpoints.

AD_NightsongApostle_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongApostle_0.text: Now you wear a face to match your soul, oathbreaker.
AD_NightsongApostle_0.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

DaisyAD_EntranceDoor_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_EntranceDoor_0.text: We've found it. The Absolute is behind this door.

KethericIntro_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_4.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro_31.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_31.text: You. After all you've done, after all your trifling, you dare strike at my daughter?!

KethericIntro_64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_64.text: What a fool you are. I am death. She is mine. She will return - always return. And you...

KethericIntro_51.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_51.text: You. After all you've done, after all your trifling, you dare strike at my daughter?!

KethericIntro_71.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_71.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro_44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_44.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

KethericIntro_76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_76.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro_3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_3.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

KethericIntro_55.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_55.text: I just want to be free of my parasite.

KethericIntro_30.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_30.text: Impossible - you are bound to it, and in death it will bind you to me.

KethericIntro_72.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_72.text: That is the power my Lord Myrkul has granted me - command over the immeasurable legions of the dead.

KethericIntro_16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_16.text: But he did not only give me power - he gave me the one thing no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro_22.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_22.text: I'm here to snuff out this whole evil plot - and you along with it.

KethericIntro_28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_28.text: Finer champions than you have tried and failed. But perhaps they lacked the fear that drives you: your freedom, hanging in the balance.

KethericIntro_75.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_75.text: I will find out who I was, and end my killing fate.

KethericIntro_50.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_50.text: And what is my place, Ketheric?

KethericIntro_74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_74.text: Your place is to die so I might finally live.

KethericIntro_36.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_36.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

KethericIntro_26.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_26.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

KethericIntro_21.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_21.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

KethericIntro_48.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_48.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro_57.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_57.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

KethericIntro_13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_13.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

KethericIntro_27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_27.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

KethericIntro_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_0.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of Faerûn to death.

KethericIntro_78.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_78.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

KethericIntro_56.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_56.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

KethericIntro_20.speaker: Isobel
KethericIntro_20.text: I'm grateful to you for bringing me home. I was a fool to resist. I know better now.

KethericIntro_11.speaker: Isobel
KethericIntro_11.text: Good luck in the City of Judgement. I wish you the best, sincerely.

KethericIntro_70.speaker: Nightsong
KethericIntro_70.text: Isobel - my love, what has happened to you?
KethericIntro_70.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

KethericIntro_53.speaker: Isobel
KethericIntro_53.context: NodeContext: Seeing Nightsong for the first time. Normally she'd be overcome, btu the tadpole is making her cold

KethericIntro_19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_19.text: My Lord, I offer you these souls so they may return as servants to your cause.

KethericIntro_23.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_23.text: Join the army of the dead, True Soul. Witness Lord Myrkul's glory!

KethericIntro_1.speaker: Nightsong
KethericIntro_1.text: You are no True Soul - you are a champion. Kill the madman. I fight at your side.

KethericIntro_84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_84.text: Join the army of the dead, True Soul. Witness Lord Myrkul's glory!

KethericIntro_73.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_73.text: I was ready to show you mercy before. It's still not too late. You can repent.

KethericIntro_33.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_33.text: Repent? Would that even be possible?

KethericIntro_66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_66.text: For a moment - a moment only - I was weak. No longer.

KethericIntro_34.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_34.text: You are planning on betraying your allies?

KethericIntro_81.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_81.text: My place is at the Lord of Bones' side, like yours.

KethericIntro_39.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_39.text: All mortals find their place at our Lord's side in time - your time is now.

KethericIntro_62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_62.text: I will continue to serve him on this plane as long as I am needed, for he has given me everything I want.

KethericIntro_60.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_60.text: You have an alliance with the Black Hand, Bane. I am his servant. You ought to work with me.

KethericIntro_54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_54.text: A temptation or a threat? With your god, it's always the latter, isn't it?

KethericIntro_82.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_82.text: I will reach my own crimson castle, and your corpse will pave my path.

KethericIntro_85.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_85.text: A mad dog like Orin might be impressed. I am not.

KethericIntro_9.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_9.text: I know my destiny - he's waiting in Baldur's Gate. And you're standing in my way, old man.

KethericIntro_68.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_68.text: I am not intimidated by the likes of you. I will gain my queen's favour and ascend.

KethericIntro_47.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_47.text: The liberation of my people may be close at hand. And I will stop at nothing to see it done.

KethericIntro_35.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_35.text: My place is in Baldur's Gate. Yours is in a grave - permanently, this time.

KethericIntro_59.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_59.text: Funny you say that. My place is right here, and my 'bright flash' could be the last thing you see...

KethericIntro_67.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_67.text: Damned wretch. I will liberate my father from your rotten hands.

KethericIntro_10.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_10.text: Neither you nor your pal Gortash know the first thing about my 'place'.

KethericIntro_63.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_63.text: I am right where I need to be - ready to vanquish you and your curse, forever.

KethericIntro_7.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_7.text: I sense you ask questions only to hear yourself answer them - so by all means, tell me my place.

KethericIntro_32.speaker: Player
KethericIntro_32.text: My place is standing over you, with my boot on your throat.

KethericIntro_86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_86.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro_79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_79.text: You - what in the name of the Nine Hells are you doing here?!
KethericIntro_79.context: NodeContext: surprised to see us, we should be dead already

KethericIntro_43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_43.text: Balthazar - I should have expected his weakness.

KethericIntro_83.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro_83.text: You - what in the name of the Nine Hells are you doing here?!
KethericIntro_83.context: NodeContext: surprised to see us, we should be dead already

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone_0.text: Ketheric's Netherstone - it's in his armour. Take it.

AD_Phase3Transition_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
AD_Phase3Transition_0.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

AD_NightsongAfterCombat_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAfterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

AD_IsobelKilled_1.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
AD_IsobelKilled_1.context: NodeContext: More fury than grief. We killed his daughter - but he'll bring her back again

AD_IsobelKilled_0.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
AD_IsobelKilled_0.text: My Lord brought her back once already. Your death will be final.

PAD_AfterCombatComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombatComment_0.text: The Chosen of Myrkul is dead - permanently, this time.
PAD_AfterCombatComment_0.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's distracted. More focused on Gortash.

KethericApostle_1.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_1.text: What a fool you are. You cannot kill me - I am eternal.

KethericApostle_13.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_13.text: Myrkul... Lord of Bones. I am here. I am ready.
KethericApostle_13.context: NodeContext: Invoking the god despite being battered and broken

KethericApostle_22.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Ketheric staggers, gripped by some unseen power, and falls into the brine pool.*NodeContext: Invoking the god despite being battered and broken

KethericApostle_7.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_7.text: No... there is no repentance... no release. My debt can never be repaid.

KethericApostle_2.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_2.text: He is watching. He is listening. He is... he is...

KethericApostle_20.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
KethericApostle_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Ketheric staggers, gripped by some unseen power, and falls into the brine pool.*NodeContext: In awe and fear

KethericApostle_17.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_17.text: You dare end one who belongs to me?
KethericApostle_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.

KethericApostle_14.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_14.text: I am the smile of the worm-cleansed skull. I am the regrets of those who remain, and the restlessness of those who are gone.
KethericApostle_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.NodeContext: This should now be Myrkul's voice rather than Ketheric's. Will require SFX processing

KethericApostle_16.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_16.text: I am the haunt of mausoleums, the god of graves and age, of dust and dusk.
KethericApostle_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul. A light glows from within.NodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_3.text: I am Myrkul, Lord of Bones, and you have slain my Chosen.
KethericApostle_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.NodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle_19.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.NodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle_10.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
KethericApostle_10.text: For I am Death. And I am not the end - I am a beginning.
KethericApostle_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle form emerges from the VFX display and hefts its scythe, preparing for combatNodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle_18.speaker: Astarion
KethericApostle_18.context: NodeContext: Just watched your enemy transform into a monsterous avatar of death. It's not looking good.

KethericApostle_4.speaker: Karlach
KethericApostle_4.context: NodeContext: Ketheric transforming into the Apostle of Myrkul

KethericApostle_0.speaker: Jaheira
KethericApostle_0.text: Hello, Death. I like your hat.
KethericApostle_0.context:
NodeContext: Flat and casual - a boss has just undergone a hideous and dramatic transformationn in front of the party, becoming an avatar of death - complete with intimidating and elaborate headpiece. It signs off its villain speech with 'I AM DEATH!'
Jaheira has seen it all before.

AD_NightsongTransform_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongTransform_0.text: MOONMAIDEN, HEAR ME! DAME AYLIN IS FREE!
AD_NightsongTransform_0.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

ChosenThree_64.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_64.text: You said it was under control.
ChosenThree_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

ChosenThree_10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_10.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

ChosenThree_40.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_40.text: *There he is: the man who sold you to Zariel to live out your days in the Hells.*

ChosenThree_69.speaker: Karlach
ChosenThree_69.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach Companion/Orphan Origin MomentNodeContext: To herself, but with shock. This is the guy who sold her to Hell and she's absolutely shocked to see him here.

ChosenThree_54.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_54.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach Companion/Orphan Origin MomentNodeContext: To herself, but with shock. This is the guy who sold her to Hell and she's absolutely shocked to see him here.

ChosenThree_39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_39.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?

ChosenThree_50.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree_50.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.

ChosenThree_87.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_87.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.

ChosenThree_7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_7.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?

ChosenThree_6.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_6.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your very nose. And you almost missed it.

ChosenThree_43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_43.text: Balthazar has them now. He'll deliver the Prism soon enough - so if you would cease these distractions, I -

ChosenThree_14.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_14.text: The distractions have been yours, Ketheric. Perhaps we never should have dug your daughter up.

ChosenThree_47.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

ChosenThree_58.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_58.text: So you haven't lost your edge. But you're still not as sharp as Orin is, I wager.
ChosenThree_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric stops short an inch from Gortash's face, who only grins wider. We pan around to see Orin casually pressing a knife to Ketheric's chest. She closed the distance with incredible speed.

ChosenThree_74.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_74.text: The slayer against the undying one. That would be fun to see.

ChosenThree_86.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree_86.text: His cryptbreath sings to my sinews, again again againagainagain!

ChosenThree_61.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree_61.text: But he must lead the murdermarch to Baldur's Grave.
ChosenThree_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reluctantly puts away her knife.NodeContext: Orin reluctantly puts away her knife

ChosenThree_53.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_53.text: If the weapon is truly in your grasp, Ketheric, might I suggest closing your fist?
ChosenThree_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smirking, Gortash brings his hand up, a gauntlet shining on his fist.

ChosenThree_34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_34.text: Orin and I can wait for you no longer. The plan proceeds - we're going to the city, and we expect you to follow - army and the weapon in tow.
ChosenThree_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash turns to the face the brine pool, holding his gauntlet aloft, the gem inlaid in it glinting. Rolling her eyes, Orin raises her dagger, its gem glinting alike. The surface of the brine pool begins to bubble.

ChosenThree_96.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: He raises his gauntlet to display the netherstone inlaid therein. It glows,

ChosenThree_56.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: She raises her dagger to display the netherstone inlaid therein. It glows.

ChosenThree_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the boiling surface of the brine pool, a MASSIVE SHAPE emerges. Tentacles writhing, the ELDER BRAIN hangs suspended. Gortash smiles - but then his face tightens in strain as the Brain TREMBLES, resisting.

ChosenThree_92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash waits for Ketheric without turning around. Seething, Ketheric is slow to comply - but he does comply, striking a pose with an identical gem aloft on his chest. A CROWN atop the Brain sparks, glowing with the same light as the rings.

ChosenThree_94.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric raises his chest slightly, where the jewelled centrepiece therein begins to glow.

ChosenThree_23.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
ChosenThree_23.text: An elder brain... one of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

ChosenThree_76.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_76.text: *The sight of the crown atop the elder brain strikes you like lightning. Never before have you beheld an artefact of such unrivalled power.*

ChosenThree_75.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_75.text: *You realise that it could change everything. Your own course. Your own life. The destiny of worlds.*

ChosenThree_63.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_63.text: *But here, in this very moment lies your chance to heed Mystra's call. This must be it: the end of the Absolute.*

ChosenThree_89.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_89.text: It's one thing to sacrifice yourself, but you will not sacrifice your friends. You will wait - there will be another chance.

ChosenThree_12.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_12.text: Or the beginning of something else... You will not die today.

ChosenThree_52.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_52.text: *The orb senses your hesitation. It shudders within you - longing for something, though you cannot tell what.*

ChosenThree_84.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_84.text: *A prickling dread rises along your spine - you have disobeyed Mystra. Again. If you survive this, there will be consequences.*

ChosenThree_82.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_82.text: Obey your goddess. Detonate the orb. Destroy the Absolute.

ChosenThree_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

ChosenThree_4.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_4.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*

ChosenThree_11.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_11.text: *Freed of the Absolute's control, they will complete their transformations. A plague of illithids will soon descend on the Sword Coast, enslaving all they do not infect.*

ChosenThree_29.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_29.text: *It is an ending, of sorts. Though not the one destiny had in store for you.*

ChosenThree_33.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_33.text: Look at that crown. It radiates with power unlike anything I've ever seen. To have it... to hold... If only I could...

ChosenThree_68.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_68.text: But I can't... This is it. I must do as Mystra commands.

ChosenThree_90.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_90.text: Gale, you cannot do this. You can't condemn us to death.

ChosenThree_73.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_73.text: What choice do I have? More than just a goddess counts on my courage: whole worlds hang in the balance.

ChosenThree_21.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_21.text: You could choose me, the one who loves you. We can find another way together.

ChosenThree_97.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_97.text: I love you too. Much more than myself. More even than Mystra.

ChosenThree_20.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_20.text: Very well. Whether I condemn this world or not: I choose you.

ChosenThree_24.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_24.text: Please, Gale. It can't end like this. We can find another way. Together.

ChosenThree_59.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_59.text: I... I have no desire to end your life, you know that.

ChosenThree_26.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_26.text: To end it... To struggle on... It is a grave choice you're making for us both, but if it must be so - very well, I'll stand down to stand by you.

ChosenThree_41.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_41.text: There we are. It wouldn't do to fight in front of our guest.
ChosenThree_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

ChosenThree_70.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree_70.text: You wag your wordflap in vain, Ulderling. Once the worm holds the whip, your shredded flesh will serve us.
ChosenThree_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin stoops to speak in Ravengard's ear. As she speaks, the tentacle unfurls to reveal a tadpole. Almost delicately, it's pressed against his eye and wriggles out of sight. He collapses, twitching.NodeContext: Orin stoops to speak in Ravengard's ear.

ChosenThree_83.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_83.text: *You freeze at the sight. Your own father, Duke Ulder Ravengard, seized by the Chosen. Yet for now, there's little you can do.*

ChosenThree_80.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_80.text: *Wyll freezes at the sight. His own father, Duke Ulder Ravengard, seized by the Chosen. Yet for now, there's little he can do.*

ChosenThree_18.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_18.text: Now! It's really time we were going.
ChosenThree_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash claps his hands, all energetic once more. He steps around the convulsing Ravengard and shoos at Ketheric, who steps back with a grimace.

ChosenThree_32.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_32.text: We will empty this place and begin the march. You may catch up with the army once you've retrieved the weapon.
ChosenThree_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tremors loosen stones from the rock wall as the brain pulls upwards

ChosenThree_72.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_72.text: And Ketheric - do try not to sulk. You're supposed to be the fearsome General, come to conquer the city.
ChosenThree_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his voice slightly as the sound around grows. The brain begins to glow, ready to plane-shift, tentacles outstretching towards Orin and Gortash.

ChosenThree_46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_46.text: And I am the hero who will save it.
ChosenThree_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash gives a mocking wave as the tentacle reaches him, touching him, the glowing building - then grows BLINDING as the brain departs, plane-shifting Gortash, Ravengard and Orin with it. Still scowling, Ketheric turns away.

ChosenThree_67.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
ChosenThree_67.text: It is time, faithful ones. March on Baldur's Gate. We go to prepare the way.
ChosenThree_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brain and other nautiloids materialise above Moonrise, still ringed in light.  The Absolute's voice booms from within, the brain coiling its tentacles around Moonrise towers. As it does, we see soldiers straighten and prepare to leave - conspicously - not a single one looks at the brain.

ChosenThree_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light builds to a BLINDING AURA as  the brain shifts again, leaving only the marching army, nautiloids moving to follow.

ChosenThree_13.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_13.text: Trust me, Gale. We'll find another way.

ChosenThree_78.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_78.text: I do trust you. More than myself right now. Perhaps even more than Mystra.

ChosenThree_77.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_77.text: Stand down! This isn't your decision to make.

ChosenThree_45.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_45.text: You're right... we truly have no other choice. This is it, then - the end of ends.

ChosenThree_60.speaker: Gale
ChosenThree_60.text: One last gust of Weave. One last gale to end them all.

ChosenThree_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

ChosenThree_81.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_81.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*

ChosenThree_19.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_19.text: *Freed of the Absolute's control, they will complete their transformations. A plague of illithids will soon descend on the Sword Coast, enslaving all they do not infect.*

ChosenThree_30.speaker: Narrator
ChosenThree_30.text: *It is an ending, of sorts. Though not the one destiny had in store for you.*

ChosenThree_2.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_2.text: Go ahead. We stand no chance against such forces. Let's end this together.

ChosenThree_62.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_62.text: Look at that crown. It radiates with power unlike anything I've ever seen. To have it... to hold... If only I could...

ChosenThree_15.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_15.text: But I can't... This is it. I must do as Mystra commands.

ChosenThree_51.speaker: Player
ChosenThree_51.text: One last gust of Weave. One last gale to end them all.

ChosenThree_95.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree_95.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

ChosenThree_79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree_79.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -

DaisyAD_ElderBrain_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_ElderBrain_0.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

AD_KethericInvulnerable_Apostle_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Myrkul
AD_KethericInvulnerable_Apostle_0.text: I AM NO SLAVE TO DEATH - I AM ITS MASTER.

CrownController_60.speaker: Narrator
CrownController_60.text: *In death, the body is cooling, but energy radiates from the stone.*
CrownController_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches next to Ketheric's body. Shot of the netherstone embedded in the armour. Player wrestles the stone out of the armour and lifts it into view.

CrownController_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up stone. A portal opens up behind it (same one we used in Astral Prison to travel back to material plane.) Daisy steps out (in cine only.)

CrownController_13.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_13.text: And now the picture comes together.

CrownController_23.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_23.text: The Absolute is neither god nor man. It is the elder brain you saw, held here by those three against its will.

CrownController_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_2.text: The crown it wears controls it, and these stones control the crown. It has been dominated.

CrownController_54.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_54.text: To master an elder brain... to subdue it... Our enemies are formidable.

CrownController_22.speaker: Player
CrownController_22.text: How is it you're able to leave the Astral Prism now?

CrownController_15.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_15.text: A temporary reprieve, but a welcome one. With the brain on its way to the city, its influence here is weakened.

CrownController_53.speaker: Player
CrownController_53.text: What can you tell me about the Crown the brain was wearing?

CrownController_4.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_4.text: The crown's markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

CrownController_14.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_14.text: It is a crown of domination. The stones were taken from its crest. They are Netherstones, imbued with the ability to control the wearer of the crown.

CrownController_58.speaker: Gale
CrownController_58.text: Whoever controls the crown could reshape the world... if they can control it.

CrownController_18.speaker: Gale
CrownController_18.text: Netherese power like nothing anyone's seen in ages. They say magic led to the destruction of Netheril itself...

CrownController_48.speaker: Gale
CrownController_48.text: Netherese? These Chosen are powerful indeed to have such magic in their command.

CrownController_63.speaker: Player
CrownController_63.text: I came here looking for a cure - I still haven't found one.

CrownController_16.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_16.text: Perhaps not a cure, but you've found the source of your infection. And the reason for its abnormality.

CrownController_8.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_8.text: The crown atop the elder brain. Its markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

CrownController_17.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_17.text: The crown's Netherese magic must be the true source of the parasites' abilities. This must be what elevates their potential.

CrownController_65.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_65.text: If the crown can do this to the parasites, I dare not imagine what it is doing to the brain.

CrownController_51.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_51.text: And it must be the reason nobody could heal you.

CrownController_43.speaker: Player
CrownController_43.text: Do you know who our enemies are?

CrownController_40.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_40.text: One of them I know. Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. A worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
CrownController_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

CrownController_1.speaker: Player
CrownController_1.text: I know one of them. Enver Gortash.

CrownController_3.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_3.text: I'm familiar. An arms dealer and a slaver. Worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny. It sounds as though you've faced his tyranny yourself.
CrownController_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

CrownController_41.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_41.text: The other is a mystery to me. But the way she spoke, it is most likely she follows Bhaal - god of murder.
CrownController_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orin. Close-up of signs of Bhaal on Orin.NodeContext: walk few steps forwads while looking at Orin who stand infront of you, please get video from Greg for character positions as ref. [Choices]

CrownController_36.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_36.text: Ketheric was a follower of Myrkul. Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are the Chosen of the Dead Three.
CrownController_36.context: NodeContext: putting together the pieces as they speak

CrownController_9.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_9.text: Since Ketheric is the Chosen of Myrkul, that means... the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.
CrownController_9.context: NodeContext: putting the pieces together as they speak

CrownController_33.speaker: Player
CrownController_33.text: Ketheric transformed during the fight - what was that?

CrownController_38.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_38.text: I believe you fought and defeated an avatar of Myrkul, the god of necromancy. A remarkable feat.

CrownController_5.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_5.text: I know Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. He is a worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
CrownController_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

CrownController_39.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_39.text: Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.

CrownController_31.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_31.text: Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul. The tyrant, the assassin, and the necromancer.
CrownController_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: If possible, show the mural of the Dead Three from END_GodsAndMonsters_WithersMeeting.

CrownController_62.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_62.text: They are known to pick from their most devout followers a Chosen, granting them incredible powers.

CrownController_52.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_52.text: Each one alone would be a formidable enemy.
CrownController_52.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

CrownController_20.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_20.text: But working together, and controlling an elder brain...
CrownController_20.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

CrownController_10.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_10.text: But working together, and with those stones and that crown...
CrownController_10.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

CrownController_21.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_21.text: I dare not imagine what they might achieve.
CrownController_21.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

CrownController_50.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_50.text: We prepare for the fight of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.

CrownController_34.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_34.text: The army of the Absolute is marching on Baldur's Gate.

CrownController_19.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_19.text: Within the city, an elder brain brimming with power, ready to turn everyone within its reach into mind flayers. All it needs is an order.

CrownController_56.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_56.text: An order the death gods' Chosen are on the cusp of giving.

CrownController_30.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_30.text: We must wrest control of the brain from the Chosen before that happens - we must take their stones.

CrownController_68.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_68.text: Our chances of success are slim, but we must not fail. If we fail, everything ends.

CrownController_27.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_27.text: I will be your shield, but you must be the sword.

CrownController_37.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_37.text: And when the chance comes to strike, you must take it. For there may only be one chance.

CrownController_12.speaker: Player
CrownController_12.text: What hope do we have if the gods themselves are involved?

CrownController_32.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_32.text: Hope is a luxury for those who have a choice.

CrownController_49.speaker: Player
CrownController_49.text: I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want my parasite removed.

CrownController_0.speaker: Player
CrownController_0.text: I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want to get rid of the mind flayer parasites.

CrownController_64.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_64.text: I know. But this is the only way.

CrownController_44.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_44.text: I know. But the path to one lies through the other.

CrownController_29.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_29.text: Are you so blind to what's at stake?

CrownController_67.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_67.text: This is the battle of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.

CrownController_24.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
CrownController_24.text: So it is accomplished. The first step.

PAD_NightsongCaged_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongCaged_0.text: So long as Nightsong's in that cage, Ketheric will keep getting back up.

AD_KethericInvulnerable_0.speaker: GROUP_Act2_Ketheric
AD_KethericInvulnerable_0.text: Have you not learned? I am beyond death, fool.

KethericDefeated_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated_0.text: Impossible... death cannot take me... I am its master...
KethericDefeated_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle lurches back as the final blow is struck. It sinks towards the ground, growing more insubstantial as it falls. 

It fades to nothing, leaving only Ketheric, who staggers, holding a hand to a bloody wound over his heart

KethericDefeated_6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: calling out to his god, hands held wide, displaying the wound for the cameraNodeContext: growing desperation as you call on your god

KethericDefeated_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees

KethericDefeated_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: head bowed, he speaks from his knees, fear in his voiceNodeContext: fear in your voice - tried to speak to your god, but there was no response

KethericDefeated_13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated_13.text: You... you have no idea what you've done.

KethericDefeated_2.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated_2.context: CinematicNodeContext:  he locks eyes with the player on the first 'you', a horrified expression on his face. The flesh falls away after he has spoken, leaving only a skull, that crashes to the ground, rolling away from his armour, now containing little but dust and shattered bones

KethericDefeated_11.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_11.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A cry of victory as she flies into the air, ending in Nightsong stomping on Ketheric's head (this will be done via animation, not in mocap)NodeContext: A cry of victory as she flies into the air, ending in Nightsong stomping on Ketheric's head (this will be done via animation, not in mocap)
Space between phrases:

The villain...is... DEAD!!!!!'

KethericDefeated_9.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_9.text: The wretch! Together we have crushed him, brain and body.
KethericDefeated_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stomping Ketheric's brain repeatedly, punctuating her words. At the end of the line she keeps stomping - she's going too far, exercising pure rage.NodeContext: victorious

KethericDefeated_3.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_3.text: Now... now... we pick our way toward our fates... unleashed.
KethericDefeated_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player steps forward, breaking her from her reverie of violence. She pauses, collects herself, then speaks.NodeContext: victorious

KethericDefeated_10.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_10.text: A pity I cannot say the same for Isobel. She may have been Ketheric's daughter, but she was my world entire.
KethericDefeated_10.context: NodeContext: She remembers, suddenly, that Isobel is dead, truly dead, after Ketheric's machinations.

KethericDefeated_7.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_7.text: Ketheric's daughter - Isobel. I... knew her. Long have I mourned her. May she know peace now - safe from her father's machinations.
KethericDefeated_7.context: NodeContext: Looks at Isobel's corpse. Devastated but steely.

KethericDefeated_8.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_8.text: Do what you must - then we fly this foul place.

KethericDefeated_15.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_15.text: Though you have great crimes against my person for which to answer, strange ally.

KethericDefeated_14.speaker: Nightsong
KethericDefeated_14.text: You have my sword - my fealty.
